metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11729 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Empty or malformed p256-ECDH public keys may trigger a segmentation fault due values being improperly sanitized before being copied into memory and used. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.8, Firefox < 68, and Thunderbird < 60.8.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11729` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

libnss3 - 2:3.35-2ubuntu2.3
libnss3-tools - 2:3.35-2ubuntu2.3
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
nss package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.35-2ubuntu2.3').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
